S.FORM: Uninang amu! Namasnava saak haip tukau'uq a kakaunun.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的布農語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I'm going to teach you how to say Bunun food.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: Masnanava! Nii saak itqaal. Maqtu'ang muqna bazbaz?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: Nii saak utan'aan! Maqtu'ang pidaingun bazbaz?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can't hear you, can you speak louder?
請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.
請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.
我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: Isia saak Pa'ian tu uvaz'az. Tupa'un saak tu Umas.
S.TRANSL: I am Pa'ian's son, and my name is Umas.

S.FORM: Isia saak Laung tu isnanava'an. Tupa'un saak tu Mu'uz.
S.TRANSL: I'm a student at Laung, and my name is Mu'uz.

S.FORM: Inaak naipa masituqas, tupa'un tu Tiang.
S.TRANSL: He's my brother, his name is Tiang.

S.FORM: Tupa'un naipa tu Savi. Inaak tu pantina'un.
Inaak naipa tu kaviaz, tupa'un naipa tu Puni.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Puni
She's my friend, her name is Puni.

S.FORM: Mas'an qan dusa isiata tu qamisan.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: Haiza inaak dadusa masituqas, tatini masinaubah.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.
你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?
你的弟妹會說布農族語嗎?
Yes, they speak the Bunun language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: Maluskun asu isuu tu tama tina?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?
是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

S.FORM: Maluskun saak tama tina siin tuqasnanaz.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?
I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Nitu makazhav, nii amin maklang, katsihalan.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: Uka luhum a, usadu'an i bintuqan.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: Laupang isdangza, sanvali'anin, usadu'anin i qanivalval.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.
The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Naqudanan unisin, asa tu madas talulung.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.
剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.
好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: Qudanan qu? Mavia isuu lutbu tu luvus i?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: Qudanan nata, nii saak minadas talulung.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Maluvluv a, masakbit inaak bungu tu kaliluvluvun.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: Maklang a vali ka, qanipasal inaak tu bungu.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: Nii amin saak minadas, mabaliv ata.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: Mavaliv ata paitutingmut tu kakaunun qai?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: Kuskun ata ma'un inaak tu timuqus.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?
我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Minadas saak haip timuqus, kuskun ata tungquvali ma'un.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here's a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: Ma'asikang saak. Iskaluni Laung mindangaz siza.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Laung to help you.

S.FORM: Mavia asu tu nitu ma'asik i?

S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go sweep it up.
Okay, I'll go get the broom.

S.FORM: Mataqdung a daiza tu vanaas a, hima'i.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: Mal'u'ang, ni'ang saak tungan ma'asik iti.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.
What do you do after school?
I'm going to sing with my friends.
May I ask if Lusing is at home?
She's at home, please come in.
May I ask if Lusing is at home?
她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, I'm Puni, please open the door.
Sani, I'm Langus and I've come to play with you.

S.FORM: Uu ai! Mililiskin saak su'u. Kula tantungu.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: Uu! Sadu'an tu madavus a izukun kaunun.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些橘子看起來會很甜。
Great! These oranges will look very sweet.

S.FORM: Tunganin tina mapit'ia paitusanavan tu qaising, kula ma'un!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I'll go wash my hands.
You try to eat and drink.
I ate a lot, I'm full.
我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.
Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: Uninang! Nadasun zaku amu munhaan asang mintivi madadaingaz.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I'm taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.
好喔!我們要跟耆老說布農語。
Okay! We're going to speak Bunun to the seniors.
Grandpa, we've come to see you.

S.FORM: Ua! Maqansiap qana amu malsBunun! Masihal maupata!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說布農語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: Uninang! Nadasun zaku amu munhaan quma kuzakuza.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去田裡工作。
Hello everyone, today the teacher will take you to work in the field.

S.FORM: Maldailaza amu, asa tu madas iskuzakuza.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.
是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we've got our tools.
Not yet, it's still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I'll go and catch the birds.
大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: Masihal maupata! Namaku'aq ata mundiip tu?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?
大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Antanngaus qai qazam, antanhiku qai ivut. Anaka amu saduu.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn't matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: Mu'ampuk ata ki tasbanin tintas'a tukii.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We'll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: Sinaduu saak madia tu ivut, haizang madia tu qazam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.
Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.
那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?
How does he usually go to school?
He took the bus to school.

S.FORM: Ma'aq isuu qudas tunda'an mabaliv sanglav?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.
What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: Tundaza naipa mataliskang tu kisia munTakau.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
Yes, he took a train to Taitung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: Haiza! Masaupa'a tanangaus a, na'usadu'an tundaza'an.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: Isaq iti mishuan tu tundaza'an basu?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的公車站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest bus stop?

S.FORM: Uka iti tundaza'an, muhaza tundaza takusi.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有公車站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no bus stop here, you can only take a taxi.
How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: Talpiaq i tundaza mataliskang tu kisia tunahaan Taiciu?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: Talbuntu ki ma'unting laihli munhaan Tumpu?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Tung Po?

S.FORM: Lau qu asa tu tas'a tukii.
Talpiaq asu tunbasu tunahaan inaak tu lumaq?
S.TRANSL: 你搭公車來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to take the bus to my house?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: Haiza isuu ail'uan tungquvali? Maqtu saak munsu'uan tantungu?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: Uu! Ihaan saak lumaq mantala su'u.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Haiza isuu kutun ail'uan? Asa saak masingav su'u pali'uni Bunun tu paliqabasan.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於布農族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary story of the Bunun tribe.

S.FORM: Namunba'av saak kutun, nii saak ilumaq.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: Tinan'a saak tu maqansiap asu pali'uni Bunun tu paliqabasan, asa saak masingav su'u.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對布農族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about Bunun traditional customs and would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: Nii inaak papiaq qansiapun, nataqu'an zaku asu amin.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: Maqtu siza'an qaningu? Maupata namadauzung qabasin patasun.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: Haizin inaak masiva'un qan vau qamisan.
Bunun siduq amin isuu tu binanau'az?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是布農族人嗎?

S.FORM: Ma'aq isuu qansiapun bazbaz tu qalinga?
Manahip saak munsu'aun tantungu. Maqtu'ang asu pali'uni ki qanup tu samu?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: Uu! Qanglas saak munludun qanup tu talmainduu'ang.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.
謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: Mamantuk amin inaak tu sinbabazbaz, isia maimadadaingaz sintataqu tu qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: Pankanaqtungin sinpali'uni. Matumasqing isuu tu sinpasnava.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: Nanu tu maupata. Namuqnang ata lakuin palisisia.
Namudaanin saak, maqtu'ang lakuin dau muqna tan'a paliqabasan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.
我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?
How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.
I want to buy two green onions.
There are three left, all for you!
How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: Muskun a mapusan qan tas'a sui, muhazi mapusan sui.
Balivang tu tikis, sauhani tastusabah sui.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: Muskun a hima sabah tu mas'an sui.
Maqlis naipi, maqtu vanaqun tu tikis?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: Mati'un sui paangun. Haizang duma asa'un?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?
Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: Panpungul saak madas sui. Maqtu saak simul su'uan sui?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: Panpungul saak madas sui, maqtu saak simul su'uan sui?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Nii! Ni'ang asu masuqis sinimul zaku'an tu sui.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: Maqtu saak simul isuu tu hulus?
Maqtu saak simul isuu tu patasan?
Pasimuli'ang saak isuu tu suzainsia qai?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: Qudananin, nii saak minadas talulung. Pasimuling saak talulung qai?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: Muhaz inaak tas'a talulung. Muskun ata talulungan.
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: Sinimul zaku tangusang tu patasan, suqaisun zaku su'uan.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: Ma'aq isuu asa'un saduu patasan, tupa'i saak.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.
When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: Nitu maku'aq, tudiip i haiza'in isuu sui.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: Laku'aq asu masuqis sinimul su'u tu sui?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: Laku'aq asu masuqis sinimul su'u tu patasan?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: Tupa i suqaisunin zaku su'uan takna?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: Isia Lian sinpasumul su'u tu ispapatasun?
S.TRANSL: Did Lian lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.
Did you borrow this pen from Masau?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: Uka'in qasila. Simula haan Mua qasila.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, let's go borrow some from Mua.

S.FORM: Tupa'i Savung tu suqaisi inaak tu sui.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Savung to give me my money back.
How much does she owe you?
I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: Masmut a, qusva'un zaku, nasulan sanganin danum.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: Siza'i kaul siin tangaa pinaak qai?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?
我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: Maqtu'in sinsuaz su'u tu sanglavun kulutun?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: Maqtu'in a tamana kulutun, ni'ang a tau'las maqtu kazkazun.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的蘿蔔就還不能收成。
The cabbages here are ready to harvest, but the turnips there are not yet ready to harvest.
哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.
Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.
魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: Makusia saak haqu malhaqu, mintun madas busul mapu'asu.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: Isia naipi vanis tu dapan, paaqpun isia naipi vanis tu inundadanan.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: Mahiqiv ata haqu, maszang haiza'in tishaqu.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.
狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: Matas'i saak islabantiq, isdamu ki tanpahukaz.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: Sia naipa lismusqut tu haqu, ismusqut i sakut.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: Matumasqing Tama-diqanin, madia haip tu qinanup.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: Uu ai! Dasun mita mun'asang mapisihal mapaqusil.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: Na masnava saak mu-u haip sia takilibus tu miniqumis a tuko-uq is malasBunun.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: Na masnava saak mu-u haip sia minlilibus tu lukis nait ismuut a tuko-uq is malasBunun.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的布農語怎麼說。

S.FORM: Na masnava saak mu-u haip sia konunkonun a tuko-uq is malasBunun.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: Masnanava, sipungul saak madas i petasan.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn't bring my textbook.

S.FORM: Muskuna isisils su-u tu issuszangan saduu petasan.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: Mubitqus in naak a ispapatas a.
Handii naak isqaqesqes a, siza-i makusia.
S.TRANSL: 這是我的橡皮擦，拿去用。
I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: Na mal-uu in ata, asa mananulu kis mudandaan munlumaq in!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: Na mal-uu in ata, na pasaqna in is.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見了。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: Ma-aq saak a tupa-un tu Pima, manahip mapasaduu mu-u.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Pima.

S.FORM: Ma-aq saak a tupa-un tu Banitul, manahip mapasaduu mu-u.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Banitul.

S.FORM: Ma-aq saak a tupa-un tu Pima, manahip mapasaduu su-u.
Pima, manahip mapasaduu su-u, ma-aq saak a tupa-un tu Dusqav.
Ma-aq saak a tupa-un tu Banitul, manahip mapasaduu su-u.
Banitul, manahip mapasaduu su-u, ma-aq saak a tupa-un tu Dusqav.
Ma-aq saak a issia Banga tu tina, tupa-un naak ngaan tu Puni.
Ma-aq saak a issia Banga tu nobano-az tupa-un naak ngaan tu Savi.
S.TRANSL: 我是Banga的妹妹，我的名字是Savi。
I am Banga's sister. My name is Savi.

S.FORM: Inaak nepa masnanava, tupa-un sia ta ngaan tu Biung.
Inaak nepa masituqas, tupa-un nepa tu Tiang.
Simaq a tupa-un tu Pima ka?
Simaq a tupa-un tu Dusqav a?
Ma-aq a Dusqav a inaak kaviaz.

S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister's name?

S.FORM: Tupa-un naak masituqas ngaan tu Abus.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister's name is Abus.
What is your younger sister's name?

S.FORM: Tupa-un naak masinoba ngaan tu Samingaz.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister's name is Samingaz.

S.FORM: Duuq maqansiap asu issia ta ngaan?
Piaq in su-u masituqas sia ta qamisan?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: Piaq in su-u masinoba sia ta qamisan?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: Ihaan asu isu-u asang tu pasnanava-an ta isnava-an?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe's school?

S.FORM: Uu, maszang saam tastulumaq is isnava-an haan pasnanava-an.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.
你的媽媽從事什麼工作?
你的爸爸從事什麼工作?
No, he is my younger brother's friend.

S.FORM: Ni-i, issia nepa masinoba naak tu kaviaz.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother's friend.

S.FORM: Ni-i, issia nepa nobananaz naak tu pakasvala-an.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother's friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Uka naak a nobananaz, lusqa tu heza-an saak tatau ka nobano-az.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don't have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Kamamakazhav a diqanin a, asa tu maqasmav quu danumbaqis.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: Kamamaklang a diqanin a, asa tu ququu danum.
S.TRANSL: It's a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: Madaing a vali ka, asa mananulu tu biaq is pasanvali-un.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: Madia ka luhum a, uka vali sadu-an.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: Na uka vali kis kutun in i, madia ka luhum a, madaing amin a luvluv a.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: Makazhavkazhav haip diqanin a, asa menuk panhapavun tu hulus is munnata.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: Maku-aq diqanin tu mal-uu tu tudiip a?
S.TRANSL: How's the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: Masihal a diqanin tu mal-uu tu tudiip.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: Na masihal tudiip a diqanin, na ni-i tu qudanan.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: Uu, na qudanan is tudiip in.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: Isdangza in, minsuma in a vali.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: Qudanan in, ni-i saak minadas i talulung.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: Ni-i in qudanan lopa ka dau, na qudanan is tonquvali in, asa madas i talulung is munnata.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: Na makazhav is pungna in tu qamisan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: Na makazhav is pungna in tu qamisan, asa panmadia hulus is menuk.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: Na maklang haip is talabal in tu diqanin?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: Uu, asa maqasmav is quu danum i maklang is talabal in tu tudiip.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: Mazima saak is namintalabal in, mopa mananqat a diqanin a.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: Ni-i saak mazima namimqamisan in tu diqanin, mopa madia balivusan.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: Uu, pasimulav ang saak isu-u ispapatas?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: Na ma-aq su-u asa-un ma-un is tonquvali in?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: Na ma-aq su-u asa-un ma-un is sanavan in?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: Sia nibu ta naak a konun.
Ma-aq su-u konun tu ma-un in petutonquvali?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: Ngausa ang asu, na kilimuk asu kis unis in.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: Ni-i, na tangus ang ata ansaqan petasan.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: Ni-i ang, masinav ang saak baluku.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: Mavia asu ni-i ang tel-ima tu?
S.TRANSL: Why didn't you wash your hands?

S.FORM: Na tal-ima saak is unin in.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: Na malkama-aq asu kis mal-uu in?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: Na malkama-aq nepa kis mal-uu in?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Uka Aping ilumaq ti. Ilung saak, miku-aq dau tu? na taqu-ak is musuqis in.
S.TRANSL: Aping不在家耶!我是Ilung，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Aping。
Aping is not at home. I am Ilung. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: Qudas, Abus i Aping saam, to-av ang hilav un!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Abus和Aping，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Abus and Aping, please open the door for us.
I am Lumav, I am here for Vilian.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: Talmadia ni-i sasadu-an tu, masalpudengaz saak su-u.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Aping, I am here to play with you.
Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: Inaak nepi sinsuaz tu hutan, siza-i tanam ma-un!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: Hanuin! inaak nepi sinsuaz tu konunkonun, siza-i tanam ma-un.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: Malunqu-a ti! Tanam ma-un i inaak sinsuaz ni-i tu pa-ihu-an tu pu-i kun!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: Ehi! Madavusdengaz a pu-i kun konun tu.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: Ni-i saak maqtu ma-un izuk si-a-av i salvi ta.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: Masala saak konunkonun i na konun su-u.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: Unin ang, madia vuus konun a konunkonun un.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: pinmade-av ma-un, madia naak a sinhanat pan-e-an.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: Ehi! Tuza tu mahansumdengaz amin masihaldengaz is konun.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: pinmade-av ma-un, madiadengaz ang a na maqtu konun un.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: pinmade-av ma-un, madiadengaz ang a na maqtu konun un.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: Madia in naak a konun a, las-upa-an in saak.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.
老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: Tupa tina tu madia dau haan ludun ta qatibing.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: Na dasuk amu munhaan quma ta.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?
Teacher will take us to the riverside.
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: Ni-i, na dasun ata masnanava ta munludun.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: Ni-i, na munhaan ata quma haip.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: Masnanava, na ma-aq mita lopa ko ka kilimun haan vanglaz ta saduu haip?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Masnanava, na ma-aq mita kilimun saduu haan ludun ta?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: Na malkama-aq ata muuhaan quma ta tu?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: Na munhaan ata quma ta saduu imita sinsuaz tu pu-i ka, asa mananulu kis heza qalua siin baqusaz minsuma!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.
老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: Ni-i, na kilim ata salinbunuaz ta.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Masnanava, na munhaan ata quma minang i sanglav?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: Lopa ang saak saduu mamangtuk miqumis ang tu salinbunuaz.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: Hia! Mazima saak talikuan i mano-azdengaz is sadu-an.
S.TRANSL: 耶!哇!我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: Iti-a maqasivung, ka-a tu mazavmazav mundaqvisan ta!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

S.FORM: Uu, na ni-i saam mundaqvisan ta.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: Ka-a tu tindangkul iti, mudaukdauk kis mudandaan biaq is na mutinkul.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: Na tunma-aq asu kis munPunghuu ta?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: Na tunkusbabai saak is munPunghuu ta.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: Na tunma-aq asu kis munPunghuu ta?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: Na tunqatu saak is munPunghuu ta.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: Na tunma-aq asu kis munlumaq in?
Na tunlehlemuhiav saak kis munlumaq in.
Tunma-aq a Tanivu kis munpasnanava-an ta?
S.TRANSL: How does Tanivu go to school?
Tanivu goes to school by train.

S.FORM: Tunma-aq a Manias is munhaan udidinunan ta?
S.TRANSL: How does Manias go to church?

S.FORM: Tuntonton a Manias is munhaan udidinunan ta.
S.TRANSL: Manias goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: Ni-i, tunlehlebunun saak is munpasnanava-an ta.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: Uu, tuntonton saak is munpasnanava-an ta.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: Uu, tunlehlequvias saak is munTakau ta.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: Duuq tunlehlesapuz nait tunkusbabai asu kis munhaan Pusung ta?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: Tunkusbabai saak, mopa sia kis tunkusbabai ka mataliskang i tunlehlesapuz tun.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: Duuq tunlehlebunun nait tunlehle asu kis munhaan udidinunan ta?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: Tunlehle saak is munhaan udidinunan ta, mopa sia kis tunlehle ka kamamadozung i tunlehlehbunun tun.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: Meshuan su-u lumaq i babalivan tu dangi-an?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: Ni-i, kadadauk saak tuntontondengaz munhaan babalivan ta.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: Duuq meshuan a sasatu-an pinunhahaqil i pasnanava-an ta?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: Duuq meshuan a kakonanqesing i papandu-an ta?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: Mesnapapandu-an ta ka tan-anak ang a na heza tu himatektek maqtu tonadiip.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: Uka saak ilumaq i heza naak a na asa-un palkada-an. Na muqna in is.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: Duuq heza su-u el-u-an is kutun in? Na kilim saak su-u kis tonquvali in.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: Uu, na ilumaq saak maltatala su-u.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Duuq maqtu saak siza qalinga? Na asa saak matsulut mapatas.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: Duuq maqtu siza ki bisukbisuk tu qaningu?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: Azuq ni-i, mopa ni-i ang saak mapinqala, ni-i ang amin patqemansutan a sankunan.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: Uu, na lusqa saak siza qaningu.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: Azuq amin ni-i tu siza-an i qaningu.
Unin su-u ki maqtu ang mun-iti pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: Ni-i tu miku-aq, ma-aq su-u asa-un istupa?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: Taqu-av ang tu malkamama-aq asu tu mendudu-az ang?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: Makakeval saak tu qabas ang, lusqa tu papal-u-un in saak.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: Duuq heza su-u lopa ko ka palkada-an tu kuzkuza-un?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: Duuq kathaan amin uvavaz-az su-u ki asang ti?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ni-i, ma-aq uvavaz-az naak a kathaan asangdengaz ta.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: Heza naak sinepuk tu tas-a asu siin tas-a qazam, maszang saam i tastulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: Heza naak amin sinepuk naung tu tas-a, ni-i tu maqanimulmul is heza sinapuk a uskunan.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: Asa saak masingav su-u ki pali-uni qanup tu is-atusasamu.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: Ni-i saak maqansiap a, ma-aq is heza naak qansepun a na taqu-ak asu.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: ma-aq sia isqaqanup tu qemangsut a heza maqma-aq tu samu?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的器具有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: Ma-aq naam iskukusia qanup tu qemangsut a ni-i ka binano-az un maqtu matiduu.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的器具不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: Duuq maqtu ka binano-az un taskun qanup?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: Ni-i, ni-i ka binano-az un maqtu qanup.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Manias mundipa-a ang mabaliv i davustilas i, uka in mita davustilas.
S.TRANSL: Manias，去買米酒，我們沒有米酒了。
Manias, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: Heza ang haan pipit-e-an ta tu tas-apaan, ka-a in mabaliv!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: Mavai kis lusqa tas-apaan, matikhiva ang mabaliv tu dusapaan.
S.TRANSL: 只有一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: Heza mu-u davustilas? na asa saak mabaliv.
S.TRANSL: 你們有米酒嗎?我要買米酒。
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: Heza! Na piaq su-u balivun tu?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: Na mabaliv saak dusapaan tu davustilas, heza ang sia tilas tu tastubutiqu.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: Handii ka tilas un, heza ang su-u na asa-un mabaliv?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: Asa saak mabaliv i nibu, heza?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: Uka in a nibu, aminun in duma mabaliv.

S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: Sia naak hulusputul a asa-un mabaliv.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: Heza ang naam a maduqlas amin malenqas.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: Si-a-av i malenqas hulus tu tas-a.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Manias, se-isaq asu sangan ang? pistalbuqtalbuq asu?
S.TRANSL: Manias你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Manias, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: Ni-i, mindangaz saak qudas naak mapababaliv sanglav tun.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: Mopa ta qan a, Duuq heza su-u al-u-an is sanavan in? Kuskun ata ma-un i petusanavan.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: Na ni-i tu maqtu ki, na mabaliv ang saak hulus.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: Temibabalivan, piaq suidaing a sanglav un tas-alinuqus is balivun?
S.TRANSL: 老闆，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: Mapusansuidaing a sanglav is tas-a linuqus balivun.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: Piaq suidaing a hutan is balivun?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: Mati-unsuidaing is tas-atingting a hutan balivun.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: Siza saak sanglav tu dusalinuqus heza ang hutan tu tas-atingting.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Manias, pasimulav ang saak isu-u tu ispapatas, mopa sipungul saak madas i ispapatas?
S.TRANSL: Manias，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Manias, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Uka naak amin, issia nepi Tanivu tun.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either. This is Tanivu's.

S.FORM: Pasimulav ang saak tu muhiav, na kavava-ak masuqis.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: Unin ang, taqu-av a Tanivu tu unin ang amin.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Tanivu for me.
I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: Uu, heza ang su-u na asa-un?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: Asa ang saak simul tau tu petasan.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: Handii amin, ka-a tu sipungul masuqis is talti-un in.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: I-isaq naak a isqaqesqes a? ni-i ang asu mesuqis.
S.TRANSL: 我的橡皮擦呢？你還沒還我。
You haven't returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: Mavia naak isqaqesqes tu is-uka tu.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: Duuq is ispasimul in su-u ki Manias ta.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Manias?

S.FORM: Na niap qo, na tupa-uk nepa.
S.TRANSL: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: Tangusa siza inaak isqaqesqes tun maqesqes.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Tanivu, duuq sia Manias ta pesimul su-u pakahapavun tu hulus tun?
S.TRANSL: Tanivu, did Manias lend you this coat?

S.FORM: Ni-i, sia tina naak a mebaliv penaak.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: Mamaszang mu-u sia Manias ta pakahapavun tu hulus tu.
S.TRANSL: Manias's coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: Ni-i naam a patas mamaszang, mataqdung sia ta pakahapavun tu hulus sadu-an.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Tanivu, sinimul asu sia Manias tu sui?
S.TRANSL: Tanivu, did you borrow money from Manias?

S.FORM: Uu, al suqesuk nepa haip dau ka, lusqa tu sipungul saak madas i sui.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: Na suqesuk pesia ta kis kutun in.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: Uu, na tupa-uk a Manias a.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Manias for you.

S.FORM: Ma-aq is malhaqu ki qamutis a asa tu makusia haquqatu ta, ma-aq is malhaqu ki tikulas a asa tu makusia haqumusqut ta. mopa ta mamantuk.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: Mopa ta qan a dau, paaq pu-un ni-i saak udamu-an i muliva naak a sinpalhaqu ka.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: Na masnava ang saak su-u tu na piko-uq a sia dii dusa haqu kun is malhaqu.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: Uu, tuza tu unin su-u, na madia naak tesaq is qabas in.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: Masmuav madaqvasdengaz in a ismuut haan quma ta, mundipa-a siza kaul haan patqemangsutan ta, na munhaan ta quma ta mavalval i ismuut.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

S.FORM: Isisila haan kalala ta, usadu-an is munkunbu in patqemangsutan ta.
S.TRANSL: 在簍子的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: Asa tu Mananulu kis ankus i kaul i, manusqitdengaz a kaul a, ka-a tu siszaqan.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: Ka-a tu kadapan inaak sinpalhaqu ka!
Ihaan lukis nastu ta naak a sinpalhaqu ka.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: Mavia asu tu maqansiap ang tu?
Heza naak i-iti ka sinpasqaal a, paaq pu-un maqansiap ang saak tu i-isaq naak a sinpalhaqu ka.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: Ma-aq dii kalala kun a tupa-un tu mat-iskaan, pihanun zami vanglaz ta patala ki iskaan.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: Uka naam iti mat-iskaan tu kalala, makusia saam ispalalaskan is malaskan.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: Ni-i saak mekusia ispalalaskan a, duuq maqtu ang pasnava zaku kis muqnin?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: Na maqtu! taskun ata malaskan is muqna in.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: Na zaku ka masnava su-u matas-i ki mat-iskaan tu kalala ka.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: Hia! Bizakbizak in su-u ka ispalalaskan a, duuq heza iskaan ma-un! kavava-i silulu.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: Mal-u-ang i, masmuav in a qatu tu vialvialdengaz a, i-iti saak silulu ispalalaskan tu duun a, mundipa-a asu siza saluzu ta.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: Silulu-av ang a iskaan mapunzaku-an, na zaku in a mindangaz su-u silulu.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: Tuza tu manahipdengaz a is-aang ai madia mita tesaq, matmuz amin a is-olading i iskaan tu kalala kun.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: Ina, kavava-a ata musuqis munlumaq i, na ispasiqtu ki mita duma.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: Malkahima haip, pal'u'un laqbinga, muskun ata munata mudadaan.
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧。
It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: Malkatau laqbing, pismali ata laqbing mina'un tungquvali.
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧。
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: Niciubi laqbing, na muskun saak tina munhaan kiukai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: Munhaanang saak patakiani, asa saak mutaq.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Masnanava, asa saak munhaan patakiani, masaqbit naak tian.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我要去廁所，我肚子痛。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?
It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Masnanava, namal'uu saak tungquvali'i, saqbit daingaz naak bungu.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: Masnanava, namal'uu saaki mauq'na malkatas'a, aupa nasaduu saak ising.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: Ihaan nai pataki'an, aupa saqbita tian.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

S.FORM: Masnanava, maluu a Balan haip, aupa saqbit a mudan.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Balan has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: Taqu'i saam tu makuaq asu tu bunun.

S.TRANSL: My name is Taupas Tanapima, and I'm 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: Maaq saak a itu Bunun siduq.

S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Uu, amin inaaq tastulumaq Bunun siduq.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是布農族人。
Yes, my whole family is Bunun.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Nii, Bunun a tama, Puut a tina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是布農族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Bunun, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: Maaq saak a isia Pima-Savi tu u'vaz'az.
Tama suu a daiza'aa? Piaqin siata qamisan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了？
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Tama suu a daiza'aa? Piaqin siata qamisan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Nii, maaq naipa a inaam asang tu madaingaz, mavau'unin naipa.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: Mastaan daingaz sia masituqas qamisan suu?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: Talmadin nitu mapasaduu, aupat muslu kasu taldaqvas'i?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?
I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: Ihaan naipa ap'ap'an ta, na pintataiv naipa u'nisin apap.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: Isaq a Savi? Na patindangkul naipa u'nisin.
S.TRANSL: Savi在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Savi? She's going to compete in a running competition later.
She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

S.FORM: Ngausang saak mabaliv kaunun tongkovali, na mun'ita saak kilim suu.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.
Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: Kilim'a duma bunun, na kilim'ang saak sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.
Is Pima competing in croquet today?
No, he's competing in high jump.
運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?
運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?
我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.
我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: Nii, na babali'van ata u'u'pun-mali a.
Tuza kasu tu malmananu i, u'siza'an i'ci-vang!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!
Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: Uka, laupang nai munata, na maqmutin mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: Ihaan nai ni-kai, munda'za'a ta kilim siata.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: Ai! Taupas qana, Talmadin nitu pasaduu, masihal aupa?
S.TRANSL: 是Taupas啊！很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It's Taupas. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?
I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: Ihaan nai pipit'ia'an ta makal'ing sanglav, u'na'un zaku.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: Munhaan nai patulkukan ta madamu tulkuk.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: Uka muu qodas ilumaq, ihaan nai quma ta, ihaan a lumaq tun mantatala.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: Talmadin nitu pasaduu, muslu'in asu taldaqvas i.
S.TRANSL: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.

S.FORM: Tuza tu manahip saduu suu mun'iti.
S.TRANSL: It's so good to see you.

S.FORM: Pimuu a bunglai'un, pukumbu'i haan piskakazha'van ta.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: Talmadin asu nitu tantungu a, na luklasuk naingka amin muskun maun.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

S.FORM: Azoq azaq, na muaz saaq quu ucia, haan ata bukzavan ta pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.
謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: Haiza laupang kinulut tu tulkuk'un, dasi mulumaq, kasasaus'i maun.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: Duuq maqtu ata pasaduu i laqbing mina'un tungquvali?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: Na maqtu aupa ihaan kaku ta? Na lasasing ata.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: Azoq munhaan ata u'ampukan ta, na nukan saak itu Bunun tu hulus.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: Mastaan manau'az naam asang tu dandan, saupa'a ti i maqatispung'in a dandan.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: Na masmuav'in u'suii i, panhaanin mauq'na tu mintalapal.
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

S.FORM: Azoq ihaan'a kasu lus'an manaq tainga ta mun'i'ti.
S.TRANSL: 那你射耳祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Ear Festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

S.FORM: Tusingav suu tu mavia asu tu musauqais haan asang ti i?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Aupa asa saak ihaan asang ti masnava uvavaz'az.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: Viatu nitu sivng haan he'ci ta masnava i?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: Aupa i'iti naak a is'ang, duuq na haizang tamasaz'an saipuk anakanak tu taisis'aan.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: Maqansiap asu matin'un'i! Simaq a masnava suu?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: Sia inaaq qudas-binanauaz, siata a mastaan maqansiap matin'un laupaku ihaan inaam asang.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: Maaq suu i'liskinan i, na asa maqansiap matin'un?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: Maaq a matin'un'un a, isia Bunun tu sin'iqumis, maaki maqansiap amin a maikikingna matin'un a, na maqtu sia Bunun tu sin'iqumis sauqabasqabas.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: Mastaan masihal qudan a davus-maduq i.
Aii! Malmananu asu! Malbubuntu i ka'davus?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: Nii! Na muaz tastu-islungqu'an. Pu'ngaus'un'ang a dulaz siin tilas pit'a'li, pada'ngi'an i tamul, pisihalun mabizoq, na maqtu'in ladi'ngun haan qau'ngu.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: Haiza naak daqpuut siin tulkum, amin inaaq sinsuaz!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: Mabaliv saak daqpuut siin tulkum, piaq sui naupata?
Maduu saak hulus dii, piaq sui?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: Masmuav maqlis, duuq maqtu mavanaq tu tikis?
S.TRANSL: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: Nitu maqtu! Maaki vanaqun a, na sumasulu saak.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

S.FORM: Uu na! Sia i mataqdung a.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: Baliv saak daus siin tipin i.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: Dusa linauqus! Inaaq naipun sintas'i, mantuk tu na maqtu talbuntu ikma'ai'un.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: Duuq maqtu vanaqun tikis a sui? Na pa'uk naak kaviaz tu mun'iti a maba'liv.
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: Uu! Na ia'sui'uk asu mapusan pasento.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: Munhan'a dii saduu! Haiza hulus, haiza amin tamuhung.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: Maaki tas'a hulus a, tau saba mahima'un a sui, maaki tau hulus a, tas'a li'no'qos a sui.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: Baliv saak tas'a, sia'i baq'lu a.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: Uninang! Baliv saak i dulaz siin sinhanat tu titi maqav.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: Ukin a qaising. haizang a tinpu'la tana, balivun suu?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: Uu na! Saiving saak tas'a, na baliv saak qaising i mauqnin.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: Uu, ladi'ngun zaku haan luup, mahima'un sui.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.
